ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Gained a much better understanding of the utilization of mathematics in everyday life and how to solve problems with basic skills--I have never been a math person and by the end of the course I felt a profound ease by which I approach mathematics
I got a review of topics I had previously learned in high school and increased the skills in those areas.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I personally don't see any weaknesses! Probably because Professor Argue is such a fantastic teacher

It was very unorganized. There was never really a plan. When I asked my instructor questions in class, he oftentimes would stop explaining the answer to me and would move on to the other group of students. I attended every class and always asked questions, but I feel this instructor did not care.

Strengths: Fair amount of opportunities to maintain a good grade in the class, Professor Argue was easy to reach & very accessible 

Weakness: Participation should have been higher, class would be disorganized prior to the handouts Professor Argue introduced, would have been helpful to have lectures recorded (or at least parts)

The manner the course was taught in was very confusing --- HW was always posted incorrectly and needed to be corrected, what we learned in class never was helpful on the homework.

Strengths of the course was the professor's ability to correctly asses the skill level of the class.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: for sure!! it gives you a base of mathematics and an understanding of how to estimate some of the world's most important problems/issue (it taught me that estimation call be applied to anything)
No. It was unorganized and I feel like I did not learn anything.

Not unless the student is interested in learning about nontraditional ways to solve math problems (i.e Fermi problems, bounding and averaging). The course description alludes that there are other fields that you will learn about such as finance or ecology, yet the fields were not discussed in great detail with the exception of the project. Psets are reasonable and the midterm project was enjoyable.
I would not -- there are other, more straightforward classes for students not strong in math to fulfill their QR requirement.
